titleInfo.title: Pajama Party for Patients of the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society

physicalDescription.extent: 1 item (photograph), 3 x 4 inches, black and white
physicalDescription.note: Handwritten on front of photograph: ''A pajama party, on sun porch, My wheel chair, Old Bldg.'' Handwritten on envelope: ''#429 JCRS 1929s.'' On back of photograph: ''JCRS, I made the paper hats, for this occasion, c 1928, from album of Bertha 'Mickey' Marks, donor Mrs. Ruth Cluff, #429.''

mods.abstract: Unidentified female patients enjoy a pajama party at the Jewish Consumptives' Relief Society (JCRS). The JCRS was a sanatorium for tuberculosis patients that was founded in 1904 by a group of immigrant Jewish workingmen along with the support of several leading physicians and rabbis in Denver, Colorado. It was located on West Colfax Avenue just outside Denver.
